author: Anonymous Comp
title: Change of computer during term
question:
Sorry if this is a vague question, but I was wondering if there are any conflicts we should know about before installing DrRacket along with the SPDhandin plugin on 2 computers concurrently since we may go in person eventually this term and some of us will switch to a different device eg. laptop. The syllabus mentions to not do major operating system "changes" and maybe this is a bifurcation of that.
Thanks
instructor_answer: The line in the syllabus means something more along the lines of “If you have a working setup, don’t risk breaking it by updating to Windows 11 or Racket 8.4.” If anything, having working setups on two computers (provided both have up-to-date copies of your assignments) is safer, since that way, you still have a working Racket setup even if one fails.
